channel.title: The Music of the Moral Emotions on Sam's Emotions
channel.description: Recent content in The Music of the Moral Emotions on Sam's Emotions

item.title: Part I. Preliminaries.
item.description: Mark Alfano maps the prevalence and interconnnections among the main topics and thesis of Nietzsche’s philosophical writings as they develop over time by paying attention to to what he has to say about affirmation, agency, the ascetic ideal, drives, embodiment, emotions, the eternal recurrence, friendship, genealogy, health, history, inquiry, justice, life, nihilism, perspectivism, the self, the soverign individual, tragedy, value, virtue, and the will to power (composite map of semantic content).

item.title: Part II
item.description: How do we select collections of text, and how do we see these results as a representation?: Principles of selection and representation selecting documents: bag of words approach multinominal language model vector space model and similarity metrics distributed representations of words from language sequences How to select the core constructs of a distant-reading inquiry. How to operationalize these constructs for querying the Nietzsche Source.

item.title: Part III
item.description: Four Methods of principles of discovery: discriminating words clustering topic models low-dimensional document embeddings

item.title: Part IV
item.description: Principles of measurement word counting an overview of supervised classification coding a training set classifying documents with supervised learning checking performance repurposing discovery methods

item.title: Part V
item.description: Principles of Inference Prediction Causal Inference Text as Outcome Text as Treatment Text as Confounder

item.title: Part VI
item.description: How to use this book in the social sciences Applying our principles beyond text data avoiding the cycle of creation and destruction in social science methodology
